Comment: I was told that this product was a good buy by many people. However, I ordered it NEW and it’s missing the right clicker and the entire wire

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2024
Comment: Box looked like it was opened before and taped up, it was meant to be a gift. Looks bad. This is the second time I bought this product. The product is fine and works nicely.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
Comment: I ordered an Amazon “Renewed” version of the G502 from I-Tech Mall & paid more for one that said it was in “excellent” condition. On first glance I was happy that it looked clean but after I turned it over I noticed an extreme amount of wear on the glide pads, which impedes smooth movement of the mouse. Several buttons are intermittent & also stick & it just feels very worn out. I wish I would’ve spent the extra few dollars on a new one, as they were on sale at the time.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023
Comment:
I am in the process of getting a refund, sadly, as I have just realized my mouse came with no weights! This review rating is for the REFURBISHED model I received, not the mouse itself, which is a great mouse so far - if only it had weights, I would be extremely pleased with it.

I like the layout, and the buttons work swell. I like these buttons more than others I have had in the past. I also don't notice that it isn't wireless, not a bit, thanks to the cloth cord (I'm used to cords from the 2000s, wirey and hard to move around in the heat of battle).

So disappointing, because I usually have great success with refurbished products, especially from Amazon. Hopefully they will fix it, in which case I will amend my review to reflect this. I am sure they will, honestly, based on past experience. But very disappointed so far this time!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024
Comment: When I received it package was terrible mouse wheel didnt work it rotated but didnt scroll things on the computer

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
Comment:
I know the mouse was used. I’m ok with used. I bought refurbished but I don’t think it was even cleaned much less looked through.

The first picture shows the bottom of the mouse pulling apart. The second picture it’s hard to see but the side where your thumb rests has a big crater in it and is clearly worn out. The third picture show the wheel which is caked with something and it doesn’t click on any direction. The fourth picture shows one part of the braided cable that is coming apart. All in all this is the worst “refurbished” product I’ve ever seen. It is going back today.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
Comment: el mouse es pésimo, es como si tuvieras un ladrillo conectado a tu pc así le quites las pesas que trae por debajo, le doy un punto bueno y es el scroll de manera desbloqueada, a la semana que lo compré las hormigas hicieron un nido en este mouse cosas que jamás me habían pasado en la vida.. para terminar el mouse es muy alto

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2022
Comment: I like the mouse in general, and perhaps this is the price I pay for buying something refurbished, so maybe you should consider a brand new one instead. It appears I am forever cursed with mice that will not last longer than a year, since this is my 4th in as many years. It's comfortable, I like the customized weights in the base, it's responsive and customizable, but the left button switch is now sticking and/or clicking without being pressed. I work on my computer every day, and over the last week it's become clear that I need a new mouse, since this one is randomly double-clicking or button presses are lagging behind. I opened it up, blew out everything with compressed air, wiped the contacts down with isopropyl alcohol, and reassembled it without issue, to no avail. Maybe this time I can find a mouse that will last longer.

Comment: I recevied mine in a small box its fine but i opened it the right button doesn't click and i though it would only have a few scratches not a whole button on working and toke long time to connect thunk it is damaged badly completely useless just buy brand new its better

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
Comment: My son started using this mouse, for a eeek and that’s it

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
Comment: I ordered this mouse as a spare for my wireless as it had good reviews but made the mistake of ordering a refurbished one it just showed up today and i unboxed it and hooked it up to my laptop instantly the mouse curser started jumping all over the screen until finally darted to the top and would not respond, i unplugged it restarted my laptop and updated the firmware plugged it back in and same thing instantly! decided to try it on my desktop just in case and guess what same thing! lesson of the day don't buy refurbished junk and the cost to send it back considering purchase price makes it not worth the trouble so i guess its a good way to throw away $25.

Comment: I got the first mouse with a broken button, and got a replacement, the replacement is worked 2-3 month and started making problems, like double clicking, unable to drag items on the screen, had to buy a new mouse

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022
Comment: Amazon Claims to professionaly inspect items but this is clearly a joke mouse did not work when i plugged it in and had visible signs of damage, also amazon claims to clean the refurbished items but it was packaged and sealed good but the product was dirty and not at all clean, i used to have the mouse and its great, but amazon did not do a good job with their claims. Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
Comment: What I received was clearly NOT “Refurbished” in quality or alike. Someone, the previous owner I assume, simply returned this used and it wasn’t inspected or cleaned by anyone. It’s gross. There are tiny hairs stuck to the bottom of the mouse, and clear signs of use on the grip pads. There’s even a splotch of something of liquid origin on the top. I’ve spent some good time cleaning this and now it’s ready to go. But, having order it yesterday and it arriving today as filthy as it is, Amazon needs to do a much better job verifying listings that claim items to be refurbished or renewed. This is nasty folks, beware.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
Comment: The G502 is known as one of the best mice ever. The problem with “renewed” ones is that they aren’t. Renewed that is. The buttons are all worn out and soft making it impossible to tell by feel when a click has been recorded. Teflon pads on bottom were worn and cracked. This mouse is worn out and not renewed in any way. What a rip off! Sending back.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2022
Comment:
UPD: Left mouse button started double click after 5 mounts, think 10 times before buying from this seller.

After deep cleaning it I found out that additional weights are missing. You hould expect worst from this seller, and probably will be safer to buy used mouse elsewhere.
